comment: Great professor easy class.

Super easy class. The class mostly consisted of discussion posts about the module content as well as some projects/short writing assignments. 3 of the discussion posts are optional, so there were a couple of weeks I didn't do any work for this class. You can tell Dr. Santini truly cares about her students and the material.

This teacher is so sweet and gave me extra credit many times because of how much she loved my discussion posts. Her content for the class is so engaging and she is such a sweet lady. You can really tell she cares about you and your grade. The homework isnt hard at all and takes max 30 mins a week. Theres no tests either! Super fun class, take her

I loved taking her. I only interacted with her online, but she is easily one of the best professors I've had here. She's super accessible, and none of the work is too difficult, but so, so interesting. For this class, she had us read A TON of actual novels- which I could see being an issue for some students- but it totally worked for me. LOVE!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Sooooo nice and easy. Discussion posts, 5 one page analysis of books/movies, a midterm paper, a quiz, and a final project. About 5 books to read and movies to watch, but tbh you only have to read a few chapters to know enough for the discussion/analysis. Bonus points everywhere. This was a great, easy class to balance a hard semester for me. TAKE

She's one of the kindest, most patient foreign language professors I've ever had. Assignments are challenging, but never impossible--she wants to push you to do your best, but she totally gets that learning a new language is hard and she doesn't expect perfection from anyone.

Dr. Santini is one of my favorite professors at KSU. I had a couple classes with her and she does a great job with helping people practice speaking in Italian even if you're not very confident, or good at it yet. She is very helpful and understanding, and I truly enjoyed every class. Take Dr. Santini's class if you're looking for a good professor.

Dr. Santini is incredibly kind and caring, and she really cares about the subject-matter. She cares more about fostering a positive learning environment than enforcing strict criteria because it's clear she wants you to care about the subject-matter, too. Would absolutely recommend taking her.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring

comment: Santini is the greatest professor at KSU, hands down. She is caring, understanding, really easy to understand, and she meets all of her students at their level of proficiency and helps them individually expand their Italian. She is amazing. Y'all all need to take her and major in Italian with her.

The class is not hard at all. Weekly discussions for each module. A few short papers. There are 5 required books, I suggest actually reading the ones that don't have Sparknotes b/c you'll have to write a reading response. 2 quizzes with 2 attempts each. Slow at getting grades back so don't miss assignments or slack too hard. A with effort, easy B.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Santini is literally the only reason I've been able to stay in school. She is a gem who is always willing to do whatever she can to make sure you have the tools to succeed. She truly cares about her work and her students. She will be your best friend. Be a minor or a major for her department.

She is a wonderful professor that works very hard to help her students succeed in every way possible, and encourages all to enjoy learning Italian language and culture. You will honestly never find a more kind and dedicated professor in your life. Little to no homework, great hands on style class lectures and excellent feedback for improvement.

I've had her for 2 GWST courses, plus ITAL 1001-2002 and 4490. My favorite teacher at KSU. Super helpful, nice, and an Easy A. The work load is generally rather minimal and only requires maybe 1-2 hours per week outside of class. A breeze, but super fun and educational. Have had lots of great class room discussions.
I've had Santini for multiple classes.  She's tough on the speaking Italian thing, but she's super sweet and helpful.  I adore her classes.
One of the best profs I've taken at KSU. Super sweet, open-minded, helpful, and loves teaching. I'd definitely recommend her. And her accent is awesome!

She is the sweetest and most caring teacher!  The problem was in this class.. The very first day she stopped speaking english and started talking in Italian.  Which is awesome, but the class didn't have any clue what she was saying!  you must pay attention! Study guides were useful!
Class is very interesting with easy work if you actually pay attention. She is very intelligent and willing to help anyone who needs it.
Very good class easy and informative.
Teaches what you need to know for the tests, very interesting classes, fun.

Excellent class for beginners. Prof. Santini will take her time to teach you the basic about the italian language. Easy going and helpful person.  Yes, her teaching style is slow, but that's exactly what you want if you're a beginner.  Good test reviews.  Easy A if you study. Not recommended for slackers.

Professoressa Santini is new at KSU, so she seems a little nervous at first.  She's soft spoken, but she doesn't like it when students talk while she's talking.  Her English is pretty easy to understand, but her teaching style is kind of slow and different from other foreign language teachers.  The book is also really hard to understand.
